create_re.ponder.analog_lever.header: Controlling signals using the Analog Lever
create_re.ponder.analog_lever.text_1: Analog Levers make for a compact and precise source of redstone power
create_re.ponder.analog_lever.text_2: Right-click to increase its analog power output
create_re.ponder.analog_lever.text_3: Right-click while Sneaking to decrease the power output again
create_re.ponder.andesite_tunnel.text_1: Andesite Tunnels can be used to cover up your belts
create_re.ponder.andesite_tunnel.text_2: Whenever an Andesite Tunnel has connections to the sides...
create_re.ponder.andesite_tunnel.text_3: ...they will split exactly one item off of any passing stacks
create_re.ponder.andesite_tunnel.text_4: The remainder will continue on its path
create_re.ponder.auto_schedule.text_1: Schedules can be used to provide drivers with a destination
create_re.ponder.auto_schedule.text_2: Comparators will receive a signal whenever a Train is present
create_re.ponder.auto_schedule.text_3: Mind that a Station can only be approached from the indicated direction
create_re.ponder.auto_schedule.text_4: Stations can also be used to assign new Schedules automatically
create_re.ponder.auto_schedule.text_5: The Schedule placed on a station will automatically copy itself to present trains
create_re.ponder.auto_schedule.text_6: As opposed to manual scheduling, drivers will not take the item with them
create_re.ponder.basin.text_1: A Basin can hold Items and Fluids for Processing
create_re.ponder.basin.text_2: After a processing step, basins try to output below to the side of them
create_re.ponder.basin.text_3: When a valid component is present, the Basin will show an output faucet
create_re.ponder.basin.text_4: A number of options are applicable here
create_re.ponder.basin.text_5: Outputs will be caught by the inventory below
create_re.ponder.basin.text_6: Without output faucet, the Basin will retain items create_red in its processing
create_re.ponder.basin.text_7: This can be useful if outputs should be re-used as ingredients
create_re.ponder.basin.text_8: Desired outputs will then have to be extracted from the basin
create_re.ponder.basin.text_9: A Filter might be necessary to avoid pulling out un-processed items
create_re.ponder.bearing_modes.header: Movement Modes of the Mechanical Bearing
create_re.ponder.bearing_modes.text_1: When Stopped, the Bearing will place the structure at the nearest grid-aligned Angle
create_re.ponder.bearing_modes.text_2: It can be configured never to revert to solid blocks, or only near the angle it started at
create_re.ponder.belt_casing.text_1: Brass or Andesite Casing can be used to decorate Mechanical Belts
create_re.ponder.belt_casing.text_2: A wrench can be used to remove the casing
create_re.ponder.belt_connector.text_1: Right-Clicking two shafts with a belt item will connect them together
create_re.ponder.belt_connector.text_2: Accidental selections can be canceled with Right-Click while Sneaking
create_re.ponder.belt_connector.text_3: Additional Shafts can be added throughout the Belt
create_re.ponder.belt_connector.text_4: Shafts connected via Belts will rotate with Identical Speed and Direction
create_re.ponder.belt_connector.text_5: Added shafts can be removed using the wrench
create_re.ponder.belt_connector.text_6: Mechanical Belts can be dyed for aesthetic purposes
create_re.ponder.belt_directions.text_1: Belts cannot connect in arbitrary directions
create_re.ponder.belt_directions.text_5: 4. And they can connect vertical shafts horizontally
create_re.ponder.belt_directions.text_6: These are all possible directions. Belts can span any Length between 2 and 20 blocks
create_re.ponder.belt_transport.text_1: Moving belts will transport Items and other Entities
create_re.ponder.belt_transport.text_2: Right-Click with an empty hand to take items off a belt
create_re.ponder.blaze_burner.text_1: Blaze Burners can provide Heat to Items processed in a Basin
create_re.ponder.blaze_burner.text_2: For this, the Blaze has to be fed with flammable items
create_re.ponder.blaze_burner.text_3: With a Blaze Cake, the Burner can reach an even stronger level of heat
create_re.ponder.blaze_burner.text_4: The feeding process can be automated using Deployers or Mechanical Arms
create_re.ponder.brass_funnel.text_1: Andesite Funnels can only ever extract single items.
create_re.ponder.brass_funnel.text_2: Brass Funnels can extract up to a full stack.
create_re.ponder.brass_funnel.text_3: The value panel allows for precise control over the extracted stack size.
create_re.ponder.brass_funnel.text_4: Using items on the filter slot will restrict the funnel to only transfer matching stacks.
create_re.ponder.brass_tunnel.text_1: Brass Tunnels can be used to cover up your belts
create_re.ponder.brass_tunnel.text_2: Brass Tunnels have filter slots on each open side
create_re.ponder.brass_tunnel.text_3: Filters on inbound connections simply block non-matching items
create_re.ponder.brass_tunnel.text_4: Filters on outbound connections can be used to sort items by type
create_re.ponder.brass_tunnel.text_5: Whenever a passing item has multiple valid exits, the distribution mode will decide how to handle it
create_re.ponder.brass_tunnel.text_6: Brass Tunnels on parallel belts will form a group
create_re.ponder.brass_tunnel.text_7: Incoming Items will now be distributed across all connected exits
create_re.ponder.brass_tunnel.text_8: For this, items can also be inserted into the Tunnel block directly
create_re.ponder.brass_tunnel_modes.head: Distribution Modes of the Brass Tunnel
create_re.ponder.brass_tunnel_modes.text: The distribution behaviour of Brass Tunnels can be configured
'Synchronize Inputs' is a unique setting for Brass Tunnels
Items are only allowed past if every tunnel in the group has one waiting
This ensures that all affected belts supply items at the same rate
'Split' will attempt to distribute the stack evenly between available outputs
If an output is unable to take more items, it will be skipped
'Forced Split' will never skip outputs, and instead wait until they are free
'Round Robin' keeps stacks whole, and cycles through outputs iteratively
Once Again, if an output is unable to take more items, it will be skipped
'Prefer Nearest' prioritizes the outputs closest to the items' input location
'Randomize' will distribute whole stacks to randomly picked outputs
create_re.ponder.cart_assembler.text_1: Powered Cart Assemblers mount attached structures to passing Minecarts
create_re.ponder.cart_assembler.text_2: Without a redstone signal, it disassembles passing cart contraptions back into blocks
create_re.ponder.cart_assembler.text_3: Using a Wrench on the Minecart will let you carry the Contraption elsewhere
create_re.ponder.cart_assembler_dual.tex: Whenever two Cart Assembers share an attached structure...
Powering either of them will create_re a Carriage Contraption
The carts will behave like those connected via Minecart Coupling
create_re.ponder.cart_assembler_modes.te: Cart Contraptions will rotate to face towards their carts' motion
This Arrow indicates which side of the Structure will be considered the front
If the Assembler is set to Lock Rotation, the contraptions' orientation will never change
create_re.ponder.cart_assembler_rails.he: Other types of Minecarts and Rails
create_re.ponder.cart_assembler_rails.te: Cart Assemblers on Regular Tracks will not affect the passing carts' motion
When on Powered or Controller Rail, the carts will be held in place until it's Powered
Other types of Minecarts can be used as the anchor
Furnace Carts will keep themselves powered, pulling fuel from any attached inventories
create_re.ponder.chain_drive.header: Relaying rotational force with Chain Drives
create_re.ponder.chain_drive.text_1: Chain Drives relay rotation to each other in a row
create_re.ponder.chain_drive.text_2: All shafts connected like this will rotate in the same direction
create_re.ponder.chain_drive.text_3: Any part of the row can be rotated by 90 degrees
create_re.ponder.chain_gearshift.header: Controlling rotational speed with Chain Gearshifts
create_re.ponder.chain_gearshift.text_1: Unpowered Chain Gearshifts behave exactly like Chain Drives
create_re.ponder.chain_gearshift.text_2: When Powered, the speed transmitted to other Chain Drives in the row is doubled
create_re.ponder.chain_gearshift.text_3: Whenever the Powered Gearshift is not at the source, its speed will be halved instead
create_re.ponder.chain_gearshift.text_4: In both cases, Chain Drives in the row always run at 2x the speed of the Powered Gearshift
create_re.ponder.chain_gearshift.text_5: Using analog signals, the ratio can be adjusted more precisely between 1 and 2
create_re.ponder.chute.text_1: Chutes can transport items vertically from and to inventories
create_re.ponder.chute.text_2: Using the Wrench, a window can be create_red
create_re.ponder.chute.text_3: Using Industrial Iron Blocks, chutes can be encased
create_re.ponder.chute.text_4: Placing chutes targeting the side faces of another will make it diagonal
create_re.ponder.chute_upward.text_1: Using Encased Fans at the top or bottom, a Chute can move items upward
create_re.ponder.chute_upward.text_2: Inspecting chutes with Engineers' Goggles reveals information about the movement direction
create_re.ponder.chute_upward.text_3: On the 'blocked' end, items will have to be inserted/taken from the sides
create_re.ponder.clockwork_bearing.text_: Clockwork Bearings attach to blocks in front of them
Upon receiving Rotational Force, the structure will be rotated according to the hour of the day
Right-Click the bearing to start or stop animating the structure
In front of the Hour Hand, a second structure can be added
Ensure that the two Structures are not glued to each other
The Second Structure will now rotate as the Minute Hand
create_re.ponder.clutch.header: Controlling rotational force using a Clutch
create_re.ponder.clutch.text_1: Clutches will relay rotation in a straight line
create_re.ponder.clutch.text_2: When powered by Redstone, it breaks the connection
create_re.ponder.cog_speedup.text_1: Large and Small cogs can be connected diagonally
create_re.ponder.cog_speedup.text_2: Shifting from large to small cogs, the conveyed speed will be doubled
create_re.ponder.cog_speedup.text_3: Shifting the opposite way, the conveyed speed will be halved
create_re.ponder.cogwheel.text_1: Cogwheels will relay rotation to other adjacent cogwheels
create_re.ponder.cogwheel.text_2: Neighbouring shafts connected like this will rotate in opposite directions
create_re.ponder.cogwheel_casing.text_1: Brass or Andesite Casing can be used to decorate Cogwheels
create_re.ponder.cogwheel_casing.text_2: Components added after encasing will not connect to the shaft outputs
create_re.ponder.cogwheel_casing.text_3: The Wrench can be used to toggle connections
create_re.ponder.contraption_controls.te: Actors on moving contraptions are always active by default
Contraption Controls can be used to toggle them on the fly
They can be attached anywhere on the contraption
While disassembled, the filter can be changed to target specific types of actors
If it is redstone-activated during assembly...
...targeted actors will be turned off from the start
create_re.ponder.creative_fluid_tank.tex: Creative Fluid Tanks can be used to provide a bottomless supply of fluid
Right-Click with a fluid containing item to configure it
Pipe Networks can now endlessly draw the assigned fluid from the tank
Any Fluids pushed back into a Creative Fluid Tank will be voided
create_re.ponder.creative_motor.header: Generating Rotational Force using Creative Motors
create_re.ponder.creative_motor.text_1: Creative motors are a compact and configurable source of Rotational Force
create_re.ponder.creative_motor.text_2: The generated speed can be configured on its input panels
create_re.ponder.crushing_wheels.text_1: A pair of Crushing Wheels can grind items very effectively
create_re.ponder.crushing_wheels.text_2: Their Rotational Input has to make them spin into each other
create_re.ponder.crushing_wheels.text_3: Items thrown or inserted into the top will get processed
create_re.ponder.crushing_wheels.text_4: Items can be inserted and picked up through automated means as well
create_re.ponder.deployer.text_1: Given Rotational Force, a Deployer can imitate player interactions
create_re.ponder.deployer.text_10: Right-click the front to give it an Item to use
create_re.ponder.deployer.text_11: Items can also be inserted automatically
create_re.ponder.deployer.text_13: When a filter is set, it activates only while holding a matching item
create_re.ponder.deployer.text_14: Only items matching the filter can now be inserted...
create_re.ponder.deployer.text_15: ...and only non-matching items will be extracted
create_re.ponder.deployer.text_2: It will always interact with the position 2 blocks in front of itself
create_re.ponder.deployer.text_3: Blocks directly in front will not obstruct it
create_re.ponder.deployer_contraption.te: Whenever Deployers are moved as part of an animated Contraption...
They activate at each visited location, using items from inventories anywhere on the contraption
The Filter slot can be used to specify which items to pull
create_re.ponder.deployer_modes.text_1: By default, a Deployer imitates a Right-click interaction
create_re.ponder.deployer_modes.text_2: Using a Wrench, it can be set to imitate a Left-click instead
create_re.ponder.deployer_processing.tex: With a fitting held item, Deployers can process items provided beneath them
The Input items can be dropped or placed on a Depot under the Deployer
When items are provided on a belt...
The Deployer will hold and process them automatically
create_re.ponder.deployer_redstone.text_: When powered by Redstone, Deployers will not activate
Before stopping, the Deployer will finish any started cycles
Thus, a negative pulse can be used to trigger exactly one activation cycle
create_re.ponder.depot.text_1: Depots can serve as 'stationary' belt elements
create_re.ponder.depot.text_2: Right-Click to manually place or remove Items from it
create_re.ponder.depot.text_3: Just like Mechanical Belts, it can provide items to processing
create_re.ponder.depot.text_4: ...as well as provide Items to Mechanical Arms
create_re.ponder.display_board.text_1: Display Boards are a scalable alternative to the sign
create_re.ponder.display_board.text_2: They require Rotational Force to operate
create_re.ponder.display_board.text_3: Static text can be applied using written Clipboards
create_re.ponder.display_board.text_4: And dynamic text through the use of Display Links
create_re.ponder.display_board.text_5: Dyes can be applied to individual lines of the board
create_re.ponder.display_board.text_6: Lines can be reset by clicking them with an empty hand
create_re.ponder.display_link.text_1: Display Links can be used to visualise dynamic information
create_re.ponder.display_link.text_3: ...then attach it to the block to read from
create_re.ponder.display_link.text_4: Open the Interface to select and configure what is sent
create_re.ponder.display_link.text_5: The display will now receive information from the link
create_re.ponder.display_link.text_6: Not every block can act as a source
create_re.ponder.display_link.text_7: Each compatible block provides unique information
create_re.ponder.display_link.text_8: The Display Link can work with several different displays
create_re.ponder.display_link_redstone.t: When powered by Redstone, Display Links stop sending updates
Once unpowered, the Timer is reset and new info is sent immediately
Signals emitted from the source do not affect the Link
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_1: Elevator Pulleys can move structures vertically between marked locations
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_10: Any redstone contact sharing this column will be converted
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_11: Supply a redstone pulse to call the elevator to the contact
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_12: The movement speed depends on the rotation input on the pulley
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_13: Scroll and click on the controls block to choose a floor while on-board
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_14: Right-Clicking the assembled pulley will turn the cabin back into blocks
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_15: Sliding doors attached to the cabin will open and close automatically
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_16: Elevator Contacts emit a signal while the cabin is on their floor
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_17: This can be useful to trigger doors or special effects upon arrival
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_18: Display Links on any of the contacts can show the current floor of the elevator
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_3: Place a pair of Redstone Contacts facing each other...
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_4: ...and glue one of them to your moving structure
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_5: Contraption Controls can be attached to make floor selection easier
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_6: Ensure that the pulley is supplied with Rotational Power
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_7: Right-Clicking the pulley assembles the elevator
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_8: The stationary contact now turns into an Elevator Contact
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley.text_9: Elevator Contacts represent a 'floor' and can be configured
create_re.ponder.elevator_pulley_multi_r: Whenever a pulley assembles a contraption...
...other pulleys on the same layer will connect to the structure
They do not require to be powered, the effect is purely cosmetic
create_re.ponder.empty_blaze_burner.head: Using Empty Blaze Burners
create_re.ponder.empty_blaze_burner.text: Right-click a Blaze with the empty burner to capture it
Alternatively, Blazes can be collected from their Spawners directly
You now have an ideal heat source for various machines
For Aesthetic purposes, Empty Blaze Burners can also be lit using Flint and Steel
The flame can be transformed using a soul-infused item
However, without a blaze they are not suitable for industrial heating
create_re.ponder.encased_fluid_pipe.head: Encasing Fluid Pipes
create_re.ponder.encased_fluid_pipe.text: Copper Casing can be used to decorate Fluid Pipes
Aside from being concealed, Encased Pipes are locked into their connectivity state
It will no longer react to any neighbouring blocks being added or removed
create_re.ponder.fan_direction.text_1: Encased Fans use Rotational Force to create_re an Air Current
create_re.ponder.fan_direction.text_2: Strength and Direction of Flow depends on the Rotational Input
create_re.ponder.fan_processing.text_1: When passing through lava, the Air Flow becomes Heated
create_re.ponder.fan_processing.text_2: Items caught in the area will be smelted
create_re.ponder.fan_processing.text_3: Food items thrown here would be incinerated
create_re.ponder.fan_processing.text_4: Instead, a setup for Smoking using Fire should be used for them
create_re.ponder.fan_processing.text_5: Air Flows passing through water create_re a Washing Setup
create_re.ponder.fan_processing.text_6: Some interesting new processing can be done with it
create_re.ponder.fan_processing.text_7: The Speed of the Fan does NOT affect the processing speed, only its range
create_re.ponder.fan_processing.text_8: Fan Processing can also be applied to Items on Depots and Belts
create_re.ponder.fluid_pipe_flow.text_1: Fluid Pipes can connect two or more fluid sources and targets
create_re.ponder.fluid_pipe_flow.text_2: Using a wrench, a straight pipe segment can be given a window
create_re.ponder.fluid_pipe_flow.text_3: Windowed pipes will not connect to any other adjacent pipe segments
create_re.ponder.fluid_pipe_flow.text_4: Powered by Mechanical Pumps, the Pipes can transport Fluids
create_re.ponder.fluid_pipe_flow.text_5: No fluid is being extracted at first
create_re.ponder.fluid_pipe_flow.text_6: Once the flow connects them, the endpoints gradually transfer their contents
create_re.ponder.fluid_pipe_flow.text_7: Thus, the Pipe blocks themselves never 'physically' contain any fluid
Endpoints of a pipe network can interact with a variety of blocks
Any block with fluid storage capabilities can be filled or drained
Source blocks right in front of an open end can be picked up...
...while spilling into empty spaces can create_re fluid sources
Pipes can also extract fluids from a handful of other blocks directly
create_re.ponder.fluid_tank_sizes.text_1: Fluid Tanks can be combined to increase the total capacity
create_re.ponder.fluid_tank_sizes.text_2: Their base square can be up to 3 blocks wide...
create_re.ponder.fluid_tank_sizes.text_3: ...and grow in height by more than 30 additional layers
create_re.ponder.fluid_tank_sizes.text_4: Using a Wrench, a tanks' window can be toggled
create_re.ponder.fluid_tank_storage.head: Storing Fluids in Fluid Tanks
create_re.ponder.fluid_tank_storage.text: Fluid Tanks can be used to store large amounts of fluid
Pipe networks can push and pull fluids from any side
The contained fluid can be measured by a Comparator
However, in Survival Mode Fluids cannot be added or taken manually
You can use Basins, Item Drains and Spouts to drain or fill fluid containing items
create_re.ponder.funnel_compat.text_1: Funnels should also interact nicely with a handful of other components.
create_re.ponder.funnel_direction.text_1: Placed normally, it pulls items from the inventory.
create_re.ponder.funnel_direction.text_2: Placed while sneaking, it puts items into the inventory.
create_re.ponder.funnel_direction.text_3: Using a wrench, the funnel can be flipped after placement.
create_re.ponder.funnel_direction.text_4: Same rules will apply for most orientations.
create_re.ponder.funnel_direction.text_5: Funnels on belts will extract/insert depending on its movement direction.
create_re.ponder.funnel_intro.text_1: Funnels are ideal for transferring items from and to inventories.
create_re.ponder.funnel_redstone.text_1: Redstone power will prevent any funnel from acting
create_re.ponder.funnel_transfer.text_1: Funnels cannot ever transfer between closed inventories directly.
create_re.ponder.funnel_transfer.text_2: Chutes or Smart chutes might be more suitable for such purposes.
create_re.ponder.funnel_transfer.text_3: Same applies for horizontal movement. A mechanical belt should help here.
create_re.ponder.gantry_carriage.text_1: Gantry Carriages can mount to and slide along a Gantry Shaft.
create_re.ponder.gantry_carriage.text_2: Gantry setups can move attached Blocks.
create_re.ponder.gantry_cascaded.text_1: Gantry shafts attach to a carriage without the need of super glue
create_re.ponder.gantry_cascaded.text_2: Same applies for carriages on moved Gantry Shafts
create_re.ponder.gantry_cascaded.text_3: Thus, a gantry system can be cascaded to cover multiple axes of movement
create_re.ponder.gantry_direction.text_1: Gantry Shafts can have opposite orientations
create_re.ponder.gantry_direction.text_2: The movement direction of carriages depend on their shafts' orientation
create_re.ponder.gantry_direction.text_3: ...as well as the rotation direction of the shaft
create_re.ponder.gantry_direction.text_4: Same rules apply for the propagated rotation
create_re.ponder.gantry_redstone.text_1: Redstone-powered gantry shafts stop moving their carriages
create_re.ponder.gantry_redstone.text_2: Instead, its rotational force is relayed to the carriages' output shaft
create_re.ponder.gantry_shaft.text_1: Gantry Shafts form the basis of a gantry setup. Attached Carriages will move along them.
create_re.ponder.gantry_shaft.text_2: Gantry setups can move attached Blocks.
create_re.ponder.gearbox.text_1: Jumping between axes of rotation can get bulky quickly
create_re.ponder.gearbox.text_2: A gearbox is the more compact equivalent of this setup
create_re.ponder.gearbox.text_3: Shafts around corners rotate in mirrored directions
create_re.ponder.gearshift.header: Controlling rotational force using a Gearshift
create_re.ponder.gearshift.text_1: Gearshifts will relay rotation in a straight line
create_re.ponder.gearshift.text_2: When powered by Redstone, it reverses the transmission
create_re.ponder.hand_crank.header: Generating Rotational Force using Hand Cranks
create_re.ponder.hand_crank.text_1: Hand Cranks can be used by players to apply rotational force manually
create_re.ponder.hand_crank.text_2: Hold Right-Click to rotate it Counter-Clockwise
create_re.ponder.hand_crank.text_3: Sneak and Hold Right-Click to rotate it Clockwise
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley.header: Source Filling and Draining using Hose Pulleys
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley.text_1: Hose Pulleys can be used to fill or drain large bodies of Fluid
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley.text_2: With the Kinetic Input, the height of the pulleys' hose can be controlled
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley.text_3: The Pulley retracts while the input rotation is inverted
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley.text_4: On the opposite side, pipes can be connected
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley.text_5: Attached pipe networks can either provide fluid to the hose...
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley.text_6: ...or pull from it, draining the pool instead
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley.text_7: Fill and Drain speed of the pulley depends entirely on the fluid networks' throughput
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley_infinite.he: Passively Filling and Draining large bodies of Fluid
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley_infinite.te: When deploying the Hose Pulley into a large enough ocean...
It will provide/dispose fluids without affecting the source
Pipe networks can limitlessly take fluids from/to such pulleys
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley_level.heade: Fill and Drain level of Hose Pulleys
create_re.ponder.hose_pulley_level.text_: While fully retracted, the Hose Pulley cannot operate
Draining runs from top to bottom
The surface level will end up just below where the hose ends
Filling runs from bottom to top
The filled pool will not grow beyond the layer above the hose end
create_re.ponder.index_description: Click one of the icons to learn about its associated Items and Blocks
create_re.ponder.item_drain.header: Emptying Fluid Containers using Item Drains
create_re.ponder.item_drain.text_1: Item Drains can extract fluids from items
create_re.ponder.item_drain.text_2: Right-click it to pour fluids from your held item into it
create_re.ponder.item_drain.text_3: When items are inserted from the side...
create_re.ponder.item_drain.text_4: ...they roll across, emptying out their contained fluid
create_re.ponder.item_drain.text_5: Pipe Networks can now pull the fluid from the drains' internal buffer
create_re.ponder.item_vault_sizes.text_1: Item Vaults can be combined to increase the total capacity
create_re.ponder.item_vault_sizes.text_2: Their base square can be up to 3 blocks wide...
create_re.ponder.item_vault_sizes.text_3: ...and grow in length up to 3x their diameter
create_re.ponder.item_vault_storage.head: Storing Items in Vaults
create_re.ponder.item_vault_storage.text: Item Vaults can be used to store large amounts of items
However, contents cannot be added or taken manually
Any components for item transfer can both insert...
create_re.ponder.large_cogwheel.header: Relaying rotational force using Large Cogwheels
create_re.ponder.large_cogwheel.text_1: Large cogwheels can connect to each other at right angles
create_re.ponder.large_cogwheel.text_2: It will help relaying conveyed speed to other axes of rotation
create_re.ponder.large_water_wheel.heade: Generating Rotational Force using Large Water Wheels
create_re.ponder.large_water_wheel.text_: Large Water Wheels draw force from adjacent Water Currents
Covering additional sides will not improve its kinetic output further
These rotate only at half the speed of regular water wheels...
...but provide a substantially higher stress capacity
Use wood planks on the wheel to change its appearance
create_re.ponder.linear_chassis_attachme: The open faces of a Linear Chassis can be made Sticky
Click again to make the opposite side sticky
Sneak and Right-Click with an empty hand to remove the slime
Stickied faces of the Linear Chassis will attach a line of blocks in front of it
Using a Wrench, a precise Range can be specified for this chassis
Holding CTRL adjusts the range of all connected Chassis Blocks
Attaching blocks to any other side requires the use of Super Glue
Using these mechanics, structures of any shape can move as a Contraption
create_re.ponder.linear_chassis_group.te: Linear Chassis connect to identical Chassis blocks next to them
When one is moved by a Contraption, the others are dragged with it
Chassis of a different type or facing another direction will not attach
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm.text_1: Mechanical Arms have to be assigned their in- and outputs before they are placed
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm.text_2: Right-Click inventories while holding the Arm to assign them as Targets
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm.text_3: Right-Click again to toggle between Input (Blue) and Output (Yellow)
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm.text_4: Left-Click components to remove their Selection
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm.text_5: Once placed, the Mechanical Arm will target the blocks selected previously
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm.text_6: They can have any amount of in- and outputs within their range
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm.text_7: However, not every type of Inventory can be interacted with directly
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm.text_8: Funnels and Depots can help to Bridge that gap
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm_filterin: Filtering Outputs of the Mechanical Arm
Sometimes it is desirable to restrict targets of the Arm by matching a filter
Mechanical Arms by themselves do not provide any options for filtering
Brass Funnels as Targets do however communicate their own filter to the Arm
The Arm is smart enough not to pick up items it couldn't distribute
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm_modes.he: Distribution modes of the Mechanical Arm
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm_modes.te: Whenever an Arm has to choose between multiple valid outputs...
...it will act according to its setting
The value panel will allow you to configure it
Round Robin mode simply cycles through all outputs that are available
If an output is unable to take more items, it will be skipped
Forced Round Robin mode will never skip outputs, and instead wait until they are free
Prefer First prioritizes the outputs selected earliest when configuring this Arm
create_re.ponder.mechanical_arm_redstone: When powered by Redstone, Mechanical Arms will not activate
Before stopping, it will finish any started cycles
Thus, a negative pulse can be used to trigger exactly one activation cycle
create_re.ponder.mechanical_bearing.head: Moving Structures using the Mechanical Bearing
create_re.ponder.mechanical_bearing.text: Mechanical Bearings attach to the block in front of them
Upon receiving Rotational Force, it will assemble it into a Rotating Contraption
create_re.ponder.mechanical_crafter.head: Setting up Mechanical Crafters
create_re.ponder.mechanical_crafter.text: An array of Mechanical Crafters can be used to automate any Crafting Recipe
Using a Wrench, the Crafters' paths can be arranged
For a valid setup, all paths have to converge into one exit at any side
The outputs will be placed into the inventory at the exit
Mechanical Crafters require Rotational Force to operate
Right-Click the front to insert Items manually
Once every slot of a path contains an Item, the crafting process will begin
For recipes not fully occupying the crafter setup, the start can be forced using a Redstone Pulse
create_re.ponder.mechanical_crafter_conn: Items can be inserted to Crafters automatically
Using the Wrench at their backs, Mechanical Crafter inputs can be combined
All connected Crafters can now be accessed by the same input location
create_re.ponder.mechanical_crafter_cove: Some recipes will require additional Crafters to bridge gaps in the path
Using Slot Covers, Crafters can be set to act as an Empty Slot in the arrangement
Shared Inputs create_red with the Wrench at the back can also reach across covered Crafters
create_re.ponder.mechanical_drill.header: Breaking Blocks with the Mechanical Drill
create_re.ponder.mechanical_drill.text_1: When given Rotational Force, a Mechanical Drill will break blocks directly in front of it
create_re.ponder.mechanical_drill.text_2: Its mining speed depends on the Rotational Input
create_re.ponder.mechanical_drill_contra: Whenever Drills are moved as part of an animated Contraption...
...they will break blocks the contraption runs them into
create_re.ponder.mechanical_harvester.te: Whenever Harvesters are moved as part of an animated Contraption...
They will harvest and reset any mature crops on their way
create_re.ponder.mechanical_mixer.header: Processing Items with the Mechanical Mixer
create_re.ponder.mechanical_mixer.text_1: With a Mixer and Basin, some Crafting Recipes can be automated
create_re.ponder.mechanical_mixer.text_2: Available recipes include any Shapeless Crafting Recipe, plus a couple extra ones
create_re.ponder.mechanical_mixer.text_3: Some of those recipes may require the heat of a Blaze Burner
create_re.ponder.mechanical_mixer.text_4: The filter slot can be used in case two recipes are conflicting.
create_re.ponder.mechanical_piston.text_: Mechanical Pistons can move blocks in front of them
Speed and direction of movement depend on the Rotational Input
Sticky Mechanical Pistons can pull the attached blocks back
create_re.ponder.mechanical_piston_modes: Movement Modes of the Mechanical Piston
Whenever Pistons stop moving, the moved structure reverts to blocks
It can be configured never to revert to solid blocks, or only at the location it started at
create_re.ponder.mechanical_plough.text_: Whenever Ploughs are moved as part of an animated Contraption...
...they will break blocks without a solid collision hitbox
...they can also launch entities without hurting them
create_re.ponder.mechanical_press.header: Processing Items with the Mechanical Press
create_re.ponder.mechanical_press.text_1: The Mechanical Press can process items provided beneath it
create_re.ponder.mechanical_press.text_2: The Input items can be dropped or placed on a Depot under the Press
create_re.ponder.mechanical_press.text_3: When items are provided on a belt...
create_re.ponder.mechanical_press.text_4: The Press will hold and process them automatically
create_re.ponder.mechanical_press_compac: Compacting items with the Mechanical Press
Pressing items held in a Basin will cause them to be Compacted
Compacting includes any filled 2x2 or 3x3 Crafting Recipe, plus a couple extra ones
Some of those recipes may require the heat of a Blaze Burner
The filter slot can be used in case two recipes are conflicting.
create_re.ponder.mechanical_pump_flow.te: Mechanical Pumps govern the flow of their attached pipe networks
Their arrow indicates the direction of flow
The network behind is now pulling fluids...
...while the network in front is transferring it outward
The pumps direction is unaffected by the input rotation
Instead, a Wrench can be used to reverse the direction
create_re.ponder.mechanical_pump_speed.t: Regardless of speed, Mechanical Pumps affect pipes connected up to 16 blocks away
Speeding up the input rotation changes the speed of flow propagation...
...and the speed at which fluids are transferred
Pumps can combine their throughputs within shared pipe networks
Ensure that all of them are facing in the same direction
While disassembled, rollers can be set to other modes
The 'fill' modes can help to bridge gaps between pavement and terrain
On 'straight fill', they will place simple columns down to the surface
On 'sloped fill', layers placed further down will increase in size
As opposed to 'clear & pave', neither of these modes will cause the rollers to break existing blocks
Clearing and Paving with the Roller
Mechanical rollers help to clean up terrain around tracks or paths
In its default mode, without a material set, it will simply clear blocks like a Drill
While disassembled, a suitable paving material can be specified
Materials can be supplied via chests or barrels attached to the structure
In addition to breaking blocks, it will now replace the layer beneath them
Note that any block destroyed by a roller has a chance not to yield drops
Rollers are especially useful on Trains, but can also be used on most other types of moving contraptions
Cutting Trees with the Mechanical Saw
When given Rotational Force, a Mechanical Saw will cut trees directly in front of it
In order to cut the tree fully, the Saw has to break the last block connecting it to the ground
create_re.ponder.mechanical_saw_contrapt: Whenever Saws are moved as part of an animated Contraption...
...they will cut any trees the contraption runs them into
create_re.ponder.mechanical_saw_processi: Processing Items on the Mechanical Saw
Upward facing Mechanical Saws can process a variety of items
The processed item always moves against the rotational input to the saw
Saws can work in-line with Mechanical Belts
When an ingredient has multiple possible outcomes, the filter slot can specify it
Without filter, the Saw would cycle through all outcomes instead
create_re.ponder.millstone.text_1: Millstones process items by grinding them
create_re.ponder.millstone.text_2: They can be powered from the side using cogwheels
create_re.ponder.millstone.text_3: Throw or Insert items at the top
create_re.ponder.millstone.text_4: After some time, the result can be obtained via Right-click
create_re.ponder.millstone.text_5: The outputs can also be extracted by automation
create_re.ponder.nixie_tube.text_1: When powered by Redstone, Nixie Tubes will display the signal strength
create_re.ponder.nixie_tube.text_2: Using written Clipboards, custom text can be displayed
create_re.ponder.nixie_tube.text_3: Right-Click with Dye to change their display colour
create_re.ponder.piston_pole.text_1: Without attached Poles, a Mechanical Piston cannot move
create_re.ponder.piston_pole.text_2: The Length of pole added at its back determines the Extension Range
create_re.ponder.portable_fluid_interfac: Fluid Tanks on moving contraptions cannot be accessed by any pipes
This component can interact with fluid tanks without the need to stop the contraption
Place a second one with a gap of 1 or 2 blocks inbetween
Whenever they pass by each other, they will engage in a connection
While engaged, the stationary interface will represent ALL Tanks on the contraption
After no contents have been exchanged for a while, the contraption will continue on its way
create_re.ponder.portable_storage_interf: Moving inventories can be tricky to access with automation.
This component can interact with storage without the need to stop the contraption.
Place a second one with a gap of 1 or 2 blocks inbetween
Whenever they pass by each other, they will engage in a connection
While engaged, the stationary interface will represent ALL inventories on the contraption
After no items have been exchanged for a while, the contraption will continue on its way
Redstone power will prevent the stationary interface from engaging
create_re.ponder.powered_latch.header: Controlling signals using the Powered Latch
create_re.ponder.powered_latch.text_1: Powered Latches are redstone controllable Levers
create_re.ponder.powered_latch.text_2: Signals at the back switch it on
create_re.ponder.powered_latch.text_3: Signals from the side switch it back off
create_re.ponder.powered_latch.text_4: Powered latches can also be toggled manually
create_re.ponder.powered_toggle_latch.he: Controlling signals using the Powered Toggle Latch
create_re.ponder.powered_toggle_latch.te: Powered Toggle Latches are redstone controllable Levers
Signals at the back will toggle its state
Powered toggle latches can also be toggled manually
create_re.ponder.pulse_extender.text_1: Pulse Extenders can lengthen a signal passing through
create_re.ponder.pulse_extender.text_2: They activate after a short delay...
create_re.ponder.pulse_extender.text_3: ...and cool down for the configured duration
create_re.ponder.pulse_extender.text_4: Using the value panel, the discharge time can be configured
create_re.ponder.pulse_extender.text_5: The configured duration can range up to an hour
create_re.ponder.pulse_repeater.text_1: Pulse Repeaters emit a short pulse after a delay
create_re.ponder.pulse_repeater.text_2: Using the value panel, the charge time can be configured
create_re.ponder.pulse_repeater.text_3: Configured delays can range up to an hour
create_re.ponder.radial_chassis.text_1: Radial Chassis connect to identical Chassis blocks in a row
create_re.ponder.radial_chassis.text_2: When one is moved by a Contraption, the others are dragged with it
create_re.ponder.radial_chassis.text_3: The side faces of a Radial Chassis can be made Sticky
create_re.ponder.radial_chassis.text_4: Click again to make all other sides sticky
create_re.ponder.radial_chassis.text_5: Sneak and Right-Click with an empty hand to remove the slime
create_re.ponder.radial_chassis.text_6: Whenever a Block is next to a sticky face...
create_re.ponder.radial_chassis.text_7: ...it will attach all reachable blocks within a radius on that layer
create_re.ponder.radial_chassis.text_8: Using a Wrench, a precise Radius can be specified for this chassis
create_re.ponder.radial_chassis.text_9: Blocks not reachable by any sticky face will not attach
create_re.ponder.redstone_contact.text_1: Redstone Contacts facing each other will emit a redstone signal
create_re.ponder.redstone_contact.text_2: This still applies when one of them is part of a moving Contraption
create_re.ponder.redstone_link.text_1: Redstone Links can transmit redstone signals wirelessly
create_re.ponder.redstone_link.text_2: Right-click while Sneaking to toggle receive mode
create_re.ponder.redstone_link.text_3: A simple Right-click with a Wrench can do the same
create_re.ponder.redstone_link.text_4: Receivers emit the redstone power of transmitters within 256 blocks
create_re.ponder.redstone_link.text_5: Placing items in the two slots can specify a Frequency
create_re.ponder.redstone_link.text_6: Only the links with matching Frequencies will communicate
create_re.ponder.rope_pulley.text_1: Rope Pulleys can move blocks vertically when given Rotational Force
create_re.ponder.rope_pulley.text_2: Direction and Speed of movement depend on the Rotational Input
Moving Pulleys as part of a Contraption
Whenever Pulleys are themselves being moved by a Contraption...
...its attached structure will be dragged with it
Mind that pulleys are only movable while stopped
create_re.ponder.rope_pulley_modes.heade: Movement Modes of the Rope Pulley
create_re.ponder.rope_pulley_modes.text_: Whenever Pulleys stop moving, the moved structure reverts to blocks
It can be configured never to revert to solid blocks, or only at the location it started at
Whenever a pulley assembles a contraption...
...other pulleys on the same layer will connect to the structure
They do not require to be powered, the effect is purely cosmetic
create_re.ponder.rose_quartz_lamp.text_1: Rose Quartz Lamps activate on a Redstone signal
create_re.ponder.rose_quartz_lamp.text_2: They will continue to emit redstone power afterwards
create_re.ponder.rose_quartz_lamp.text_3: When multiple lamps are arranged in a group...
create_re.ponder.rose_quartz_lamp.text_4: ...activating a Lamp will focus the signal to it, deactivating all others
create_re.ponder.rose_quartz_lamp.text_5: Comparators output based on the distance to a powered lamp
create_re.ponder.rose_quartz_lamp.text_6: The Lamps can also be toggled manually using a Wrench
create_re.ponder.rotation_speed_controll: Rot. Speed Controllers relay rotation from their axis to a Large Cogwheel above them
Using the value panel on its side, the conveyed speed can be configured
create_re.ponder.sail.text_1: Sails are handy blocks to create_re Windmills with
create_re.ponder.sail.text_2: They will attach to blocks and each other without the need of Super Glue or Chassis Blocks
create_re.ponder.sail.text_3: Right-Click with Dye to paint them
create_re.ponder.sail.text_4: Right-Click with Shears to turn them back into frames
create_re.ponder.sail_frame.text_1: Sail Frames are handy blocks to create_re Windmills with
create_re.ponder.sail_frame.text_2: They will attach to blocks and each other without the need of Super Glue or Chassis Blocks
create_re.ponder.sequenced_gearshift.hea: Controlling Rotational Speed using Sequenced Gearshifts
create_re.ponder.sequenced_gearshift.tex: Seq. Gearshifts relay rotation by following a timed list of instructions
Right-click it to open the Configuration UI
Upon receiving a Redstone Signal, it will start running its configured sequence
Once finished, it waits for the next Redstone Signal and starts over
A redstone comparator can be used to read the current progress
create_re.ponder.shaft.text_1: Shafts will relay rotation in a straight line.
create_re.ponder.shaft_casing.text_1: Brass or Andesite Casing can be used to decorate Shafts
create_re.ponder.shared.behaviour_modify: This behaviour can be modified using the value panel
create_re.ponder.shared.movement_anchors: With the help of Super Glue, larger structures can be moved
create_re.ponder.shared.storage_on_contr: Inventories attached to the Contraption will pick up their drops automatically
create_re.ponder.smart_chute.text_1: Smart Chutes are vertical chutes with additional control
create_re.ponder.smart_chute.text_2: Items in the filter slot specify what to extract or transfer
create_re.ponder.smart_chute.text_3: Use the value panel to specify the extracted stack size
create_re.ponder.smart_chute.text_4: Redstone power will prevent Smart Chutes from acting.
create_re.ponder.smart_observer.text_1: Smart Observers can be used to detect a variety of events
create_re.ponder.smart_observer.text_2: It can detect items or fluids inside of generic containers
create_re.ponder.smart_observer.text_3: The filter slot can be used to look for specific contents only
create_re.ponder.smart_observer.text_4: It also activates when the block itself matches the filter
create_re.ponder.smart_observer.text_5: Additionally, smart observers can monitor belts, chutes and pipes
create_re.ponder.smart_observer.text_6: ...and will emit a pulse, if an item enters or exits a funnel
create_re.ponder.smart_pipe.header: Controlling Fluid flow using Smart Pipes
create_re.ponder.smart_pipe.text_1: Smart pipes can help control flows by fluid type
create_re.ponder.smart_pipe.text_2: When placed directly at the source, they can specify the type of fluid to extract
create_re.ponder.smart_pipe.text_3: Simply Right-Click their filter slot with any item containing the desired fluid
create_re.ponder.smart_pipe.text_4: When placed further down a pipe network, smart pipes will only let matching fluids continue
create_re.ponder.speedometer.header: Monitoring Kinetic information using the Speedometer
create_re.ponder.speedometer.text_1: The Speedometer displays the current Speed of attached components
create_re.ponder.speedometer.text_2: When wearing Engineers' Goggles, the player can get more detailed information from the Gauge
create_re.ponder.speedometer.text_3: Comparators can emit analog Restone Signals relative to the Speedometer's measurements
create_re.ponder.spout_filling.text_1: The Spout can fill fluid holding items provided beneath it
create_re.ponder.spout_filling.text_2: The content of a Spout cannot be accessed manually
create_re.ponder.spout_filling.text_3: Instead, Pipes can be used to supply it with fluids
create_re.ponder.spout_filling.text_4: The Input items can be placed on a Depot under the Spout
create_re.ponder.spout_filling.text_5: When items are provided on a belt...
create_re.ponder.spout_filling.text_6: The Spout will hold and process them automatically
create_re.ponder.stabilized_bearings.tex: Whenever Mechanical Bearings are themselves part of a moving Structure..
..they will attempt to keep themselves upright
Once again, the bearing will attach to the block in front of it
As a result, the entire sub-Contraption will stay upright
create_re.ponder.steam_engine.text_1: Steam Engines can be placed on a Fluid Tank
create_re.ponder.steam_engine.text_2: Clicking the engine with a Shaft create_res the Kinetic Output
create_re.ponder.steam_engine.text_3: With sufficient Heat, Water and Boiler space...
create_re.ponder.steam_engine.text_5: The minimal setup requires 4 Fluid Tanks
create_re.ponder.steam_engine.text_6: With the help of Blaze Burners, the power output can be increased
create_re.ponder.steam_engine.text_7: Higher power levels require more Water, Size and Heat
create_re.ponder.steam_engine.text_8: The boiler's current power level can be inspected with Engineer's Goggles
create_re.ponder.steam_engine.text_9: With each added power level, an additional Engine can output at full capacity
create_re.ponder.steam_whistle.text_1: Steam Whistles can be placed on a Fluid Tank
create_re.ponder.steam_whistle.text_2: If the tank receives sufficient heat...
create_re.ponder.steam_whistle.text_3: ...the Whistle will play a note when activated
create_re.ponder.steam_whistle.text_4: Use a Whistle item on the block to lower its pitch
create_re.ponder.steam_whistle.text_5: Cycle between three different octaves using a Wrench
create_re.ponder.steam_whistle.text_6: Engineer's Goggles can help to find out the current pitch of a Whistle
create_re.ponder.sticker.text_1: Stickers are ideal for Redstone-controlled block attachment
create_re.ponder.sticker.text_2: Upon receiving a signal, it will toggle its state
create_re.ponder.sticker.text_3: If it is now moved in a contraption, the block will move with it
create_re.ponder.sticker.text_4: Toggled once again, the block is no longer attached
create_re.ponder.stressometer.header: Monitoring Kinetic information using the Stressometer
create_re.ponder.stressometer.text_1: The Stressometer displays the current Stress Capacity of the attached kinetic network
create_re.ponder.stressometer.text_2: When wearing Engineers' Goggles, the player can get more detailed information from the Gauge
create_re.ponder.stressometer.text_3: Comparators can emit analog Restone Signals relative to the Stressometer's measurements
create_re.ponder.subject: Subject of this scene
create_re.ponder.super_glue.text_1: Super Glue groups blocks together into moving contraptions
create_re.ponder.super_glue.text_2: Clicking two endpoints create_res a new 'glued' area
create_re.ponder.super_glue.text_3: To remove a box, punch it with the glue item in hand
create_re.ponder.super_glue.text_4: Adjacent blocks sharing an area will pull each other along
create_re.ponder.super_glue.text_5: Overlapping glue volumes will move together
create_re.ponder.super_glue.text_6: Blocks hanging on others usually do not require glue
create_re.ponder.tag.arm_targets.descrip: Components which can be selected as inputs or outputs to the Mechanical Arm
create_re.ponder.tag.contraption_actor.d: Components which expose special behaviour when attached to a moving contraption
create_re.ponder.tag.contraption_assembl: Tools and Components used to assemble structures moved as an animated Contraption
create_re.ponder.tag.creative.descriptio: Components not usually available for Survival Mode
create_re.ponder.tag.decoration.descript: Components used mostly for decorative purposes
create_re.ponder.tag.display_sources.des: Components or Blocks which offer some data that can be read with a Display Link
create_re.ponder.tag.display_targets.des: Components or Blocks which can process and display the data received from a Display Link
create_re.ponder.tag.fluids.description: Components which help relaying and making use of Fluids
Components which make use of Rotational Force
create_re.ponder.tag.kinetic_relays.desc: Components which help relaying Rotational Force elsewhere
create_re.ponder.tag.logistics.descripti: Components which help moving items around
create_re.ponder.tag.movement_anchor.des: Components which allow the creation of moving contraptions, animating an attached structure in a variety of ways
create_re.ponder.tag.recently_updated.de: Components that have been added or changed significantly in the latest versions of Create
create_re.ponder.tag.redstone.descriptio: Components which help with redstone engineering
create_re.ponder.tag.train_related.descr: Components used in the construction or management of Train Contraptions
create_re.ponder.tag.windmill_sails.desc: Blocks that count towards the strength of a Windmill Contraption when assembled. Each of these have equal efficiency in doing so.
create_re.ponder.threshold_switch.text_1: Threshold Switches monitor the fill level of containers
create_re.ponder.threshold_switch.text_2: When the inventory content exceeds the upper threshold...
create_re.ponder.threshold_switch.text_3: ...the switch will change its redstone output
create_re.ponder.threshold_switch.text_4: The signal stays until the lower threshold is reached
create_re.ponder.threshold_switch.text_5: The redstone output can now be used to control item supply, keeping the buffer filled
create_re.ponder.threshold_switch.text_6: The specific thresholds can be changed in the UI
create_re.ponder.threshold_switch.text_7: A filter can help to only count specific contents toward the total
create_re.ponder.threshold_switch.text_8: Fluid buffers can be monitored in a similar fashion
create_re.ponder.threshold_switch.text_9: ...as well as, curiously, the length of an extended rope pulley
create_re.ponder.track_chunks.text_1: Tracks stay functional outside of loaded chunks
create_re.ponder.track_chunks.text_2: Trains will travel through inactive sections of the world without issue
create_re.ponder.track_chunks.text_3: They will still stop at stations or red signals
create_re.ponder.track_chunks.text_4: However, Drills and other on-board machines will not operate
create_re.ponder.track_chunks.text_5: Once near a Player, the train will re-appear
create_re.ponder.track_observer.text_1: Select a Train Track then place the Observer nearby
create_re.ponder.track_observer.text_2: The Observer will detect any Trains passing over the marker
create_re.ponder.track_observer.text_3: Observers can be filtered to activate for matching cargo
create_re.ponder.track_placement.text_1: A new type of rail designed for Train Contraptions
create_re.ponder.track_placement.text_2: To place rows of track in bulk, click on an existing track
create_re.ponder.track_placement.text_3: Then place or select a second track
create_re.ponder.track_placement.text_4: Tracks can also be placed as turns or slopes
create_re.ponder.track_placement.text_5: When connecting, tracks will try to make each turn equally sized
create_re.ponder.track_placement.text_6: Holding the sprint key while connecting...
create_re.ponder.track_placement.text_7: ...will create_re the longest fitting bend instead
create_re.ponder.track_placement.text_8: Materials in the off-hand will be paved under tracks automatically
create_re.ponder.track_portal.text_1: Tracks placed up against a nether portal...
create_re.ponder.track_portal.text_2: ...will attempt to create_re a paired track on the other side
create_re.ponder.track_portal.text_3: Trains on this track are now able to travel across dimensions
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_1: Select a Train Track then place the Station nearby
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_10: Every Train requires Train Controls on board
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_11: An optional second one allows departure from Stations in both directions
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_12: Open the Station UI and confirm the Assembly process
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_13: Trains can be disassembled back into blocks at stations only
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_14: When used on a station, maps will add a labeled marker at the location
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_15: Assembled Trains can be relocated to nearby Tracks using the Wrench
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_2: Stations are the Waypoints of your Track Network
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_3: To create_re a new Train, open the UI and switch to Assembly Mode
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_4: During Assembly no scheduled trains will approach this station
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_5: Create new bogeys by using Train Casing on Tracks
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_6: Click the track again to cycle between bogey designs
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_7: Attach blocks with the help of Super Glue
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_8: Assembled Trains will move faster if they can find fuel in assembled chests or barrels
create_re.ponder.train_assembly.text_9: Fuel stored in Vaults will not be consumed by the train
create_re.ponder.train_controls.text_1: Train Controls are required on every train contraption
create_re.ponder.train_controls.text_2: Once assembled, right-click the block to start driving
create_re.ponder.train_controls.text_3: Accelerate and steer the Train using movement keybinds
create_re.ponder.train_controls.text_4: If desired, the top speed can be fine-tuned using the mouse wheel
create_re.ponder.train_controls.text_5: Hold space to approach a nearby Station
create_re.ponder.train_controls.text_6: Trains can only be disassembled back into blocks at Stations
create_re.ponder.train_controls.text_7: Assembled Whistles can be activated with the sprint key
create_re.ponder.train_controls.text_8: Sneak or click again to stop controlling the Train
create_re.ponder.train_schedule.text_1: Schedules allow Trains to be controlled by other Drivers
create_re.ponder.train_schedule.text_2: Right-click with the item in hand to open its Interface
create_re.ponder.train_schedule.text_3: Once programmed, the Schedule can be handed off to a Train Driver
create_re.ponder.train_schedule.text_4: Any mob or blaze burner sitting in front of Train Controls is an eligible conductor
create_re.ponder.train_schedule.text_5: Creatures on a lead can be given their seat more conveniently
create_re.ponder.train_schedule.text_6: Schedules can be retrieved from Drivers at any moment
Select a Train Track then place the Signal nearby
Signals control the flow of Trains not driven by players
Scheduled Trains will never cross signals in the opposite direction
...unless a second signal is added facing the opposite way.
Nixie tubes can be attached to make a signal's lights more visible
create_re.ponder.train_signal_redstone.t: Signals can be forced red by a redstone signal
Conversely, red signals emit a comparator output
Train Signals divide a track into segments
If a Segment is occupied, no other Trains will be allowed entry
Thus, each Segment will contain only one Train at a time
A second Signal mode is available via the Wrench
Segments of a brass signal usually lead into standard signals
This special Signal can stop trains under a second condition
It will stop Trains, which, upon entering...
...would not be able to leave the Segment immediately
This helps keeping queued Trains out of a busy Segment
create_re.ponder.valve_handle.text_1: Valve handles can be used to rotate components by a precise angle
create_re.ponder.valve_handle.text_2: The angle can be configured on the input panel
create_re.ponder.valve_handle.text_4: Sneak-Right-Click to activate it in the opposite direction
create_re.ponder.valve_handle.text_5: Mind that Bearings have to be specifically told not to disassemble
create_re.ponder.valve_handle.text_6: Valve handles can be dyed for aesthetic purposes
create_re.ponder.valve_pipe.text_1: Valve pipes help control fluids propagating through pipe networks
create_re.ponder.valve_pipe.text_2: Their shaft input controls whether fluid is currently allowed through
create_re.ponder.valve_pipe.text_3: Given Rotational Force in the opening direction, the valve will open up
create_re.ponder.valve_pipe.text_4: It can be closed again by reversing the input rotation
create_re.ponder.water_wheel.header: Generating Rotational Force using Water Wheels
create_re.ponder.water_wheel.text_1: Water Wheels draw force from adjacent Water Currents
create_re.ponder.water_wheel.text_2: Covering additional sides will not improve its kinetic output further
create_re.ponder.water_wheel.text_3: Use wood planks on the wheel to change its appearance
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector.text_1: Sneak and Right-Click holding an Ejector to select its target location
It is now limited to this stack size, and only activates when its held stack reaches this amount
Mobs and Players will always trigger an Ejector when stepping on it
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector.text_2: The placed ejector will now launch objects to the marked location
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector.text_3: A valid target can be at any height or distance within range
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector.text_4: They cannot however be off to a side
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector.text_5: If no valid Target was selected, it will simply target the block directly in front
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector.text_6: Supply Rotational Force in order to charge it up
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector.text_7: Items placed on the ejector cause it to trigger
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector.text_8: If Inventories are targeted, the ejector will wait until there is space
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector.text_9: Using the value panel, a required Stack Size can be configured
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector_redsto: When powered by Redstone, Ejectors will not activate
Observers can detect when Ejectors activate
create_re.ponder.weighted_ejector_tunnel: Splitting item stacks using Weighted Ejectors
Combined with Brass Tunnels, Ejectors can split item stacks by specific amounts
First, configure the Brass Tunnel to 'Prefer Nearest', in order to prioritize its side output
The Stack Size set on the Ejector now determines the amount to be split off
While a new stack of the configured size exits the side output...
...the remainder will continue on its path
create_re.ponder.windmill_source.header: Generating Rotational Force using Windmill Bearings
create_re.ponder.windmill_source.text_1: Windmill Bearings attach to the block in front of them
create_re.ponder.windmill_source.text_2: Create a movable structure with the help of Super Glue
create_re.ponder.windmill_source.text_3: If enough Sail-like blocks are included, this can act as a Windmill
create_re.ponder.windmill_source.text_4: Activated with Right-Click, the Windmill Bearing will start providing Rotational Force
create_re.ponder.windmill_source.text_5: The Amount of Sail Blocks determine its Rotation Speed
create_re.ponder.windmill_source.text_6: Use the value panel to configure its rotation direction
create_re.ponder.windmill_source.text_7: Right-click the Bearing anytime to stop and edit the Structure again
create_re.ponder.windmill_structure.head: Windmill Contraptions
create_re.ponder.windmill_structure.text: Any Structure can count as a valid Windmill, as long as it contains at least 8 sail-like Blocks.
create_re.schedule.applied_to_train: Train is now following this Schedule
create_re.schedule.instruction.throttle_: Affects the top speed of the Train
create_re.schedule.no_stops: This Schedule does not have any Stops yet
create_re.schedule.non_controlling_seat: Conductor needs to sit in front of a Controls block
create_re.schedule.remove_with_empty_han: Remove current Schedule with an Empty Hand
create_re.schematic.error: Schematic failed to Load - Check Game Logs
create_re.schematic.invalid: [!] Invalid Item - Use the Schematic Table instead
create_re.schematic.tool.deploy.descript: Moves the structure to a location.
Right-Click on the ground to place.
Hold [Ctrl] to select at a fixed distance.
create_re.schematic.tool.flip.descriptio: Flips the Schematic along the face you select.
Point at the Schematic and [CTRL]-Scroll to flip it.
create_re.schematic.tool.move.descriptio: Point at the Schematic and [CTRL]-Scroll to push it.
create_re.schematic.tool.print.descripti: Instantly places the structure in the world.
[Right-Click] to confirm placement at the current location.
This tool is for Creative Mode only.
create_re.schematic.tool.rotate.descript: Rotates the Schematic around its center.
create_re.schematicAndQuill.failed: Failed to save schematic, check logs for details
create_re.schematicAndQuill.instant_fail: Schematic instant-upload failed, check logs for details
create_re.schematicAndQuill.title: Schematic Name:
create_re.schematics.maxAllowedSize: The maximum allowed schematic file size is:

_Matches items_ against a set of _attributes_ or _categories_. Can be used in _Filter Slots_ of Create's Components
item.create_re.blaze_cake.tooltip.summar: A Delicious treat for your hard-working _Blaze Burners_. Gets them all fired up!
item.create_re.builders_tea.tooltip.summ: The perfect drink to get the day started- _Motivating_ and _Saturating._
item.create_re.copper_backtank.tooltip.b: Provides _Pressurized_ _Air_ to Equipment that requires it.
_Collects_ _Pressurized_ _Air_ at a rate depending on the Rotational Speed.
item.create_re.copper_diving_boots.toolt: Wielder _descends_ more _quickly_ in liquids. Grants the ability to _walk_ and _jump_ underwater. Wielder also is no longer affected by _Mechanical_ _Belts_.
A pair of _heavy_ _boots_, allowing for better traversal of the Ocean floor.
item.create_re.copper_diving_helmet.tool: Provides the _Water Breathing_ effect, slowly draining _Air Pressure_ from the Backtank.
Together with a _Backtank_, allows the wielder to _breathe_ _underwater_ for an extended amount of time.
item.create_re.crafting_blueprint.behavi: Opens a _Crafting_ _menu_ allowing you to _configure_ a _recipe_ and items to display.
_Applies_ the _configured_ _recipe_ with matching Ingredients found in your _Inventory_. _Sneak_ to craft up to a _Stack_ of items.
item.create_re.crafting_blueprint.toolti: _Placed_ on a wall, it can be used to _specify_ _ingredient_ _arrangements_ for easier manual crafting. Each slot represents a Recipe.
item.create_re.creative_blaze_cake.toolt: A very special treat for your _Blaze Burners_. After eating this cake, Blaze Burners will _never run out of fuel_.
item.create_re.empty_schematic.tooltip.s: Used as a recipe ingredient and for writing at the _Schematic Table_.
item.create_re.experience_nugget.tooltip: A speck of _inspiration_ from your fantastic inventions.
item.create_re.extendo_grip.tooltip.beha: Increases _reach distance_ of items used in the _Main-Hand_.
_No_ _Durability_ will be used. Instead, _Air_ _pressure_ is drained from the Tank
item.create_re.extendo_grip.tooltip.summ: Greatly _increases reach distance_ of the wielder. Can be powered with _Air_ _Pressure_ from a _Backtank_
item.create_re.filter.tooltip.summary: _Matches items_ against a collection of _items_ or _other filters_. Can be used in _Filter Slots_ of Create's Components
item.create_re.goggles.tooltip.behaviour: _Kinetic components_ show added _Stress Impact_ or _Capacity_. _Stressometers_ show statistics of their _attached kinetic network_. Some other blocks reveal information such as item and fluid content.
item.create_re.goggles.tooltip.summary: Augments your HUD with _miscellaneous information_ about placed components.
item.create_re.handheld_worldshaper.tool: _Targeted block_ will become the _material_ placed by the shaper.
Applies currently selected _Brush_ and _Tool_ at the targeted location.
_Creative mode_ tool for large-scale _landscaping_ from a distance.
item.create_re.linked_controller.tooltip: _Toggles_ the controller. _Movement_ _controls_ are taken over while its active.
Enables _Bind Mode_, press one of the _six controls_ to bind it to the _Links' Frequency_.
Places the Controller into the Lectern for easy activation. (R-Click while Sneaking to retrieve it)
Grants _handheld_ _control_ over _Redstone Link_ frequencies assigned to its _six_ _buttons_.
item.create_re.minecart_coupling.tooltip: _Chains_ together individual _Minecarts_, causing them to move as a group.
item.create_re.netherite_backtank.toolti: Provides _Pressurized_ _Air_ to Equipment that requires it.
_Collects_ _Pressurized_ _Air_ at a rate depending on the Rotational Speed.
item.create_re.netherite_diving_boots.to: Wielder _descends_ more _quickly_ in liquids. Grants the ability to _walk_ and _jump_ underwater. Wielder also is no longer affected by _Mechanical_ _Belts_.
A pair of _heavy_ _boots_, allowing for better traversal of the Ocean floor, including Oceans made of Lava.
item.create_re.netherite_diving_helmet.t: Provides immunity to _Fire_ and _Lava_, slowly draining _Air Pressure_ from the Backtank. Also grants _improved vision_ in Lava
Together with a _Netherite Backtank_, this can protect you from _extreme heat_. To be effective, _Legs and Feet_ have to be covered in _Netherite_, too.
item.create_re.potato_cannon.tooltip.beh: _No_ _Durability_ will be used. Instead, _Air_ _pressure_ is drained from the Tank
item.create_re.potato_cannon.tooltip.sum: Launches your home-grown vegetables at Enemies. Can be powered with _Air_ _Pressure_ from a _Backtank_
item.create_re.sand_paper.tooltip.behavi: Applies polish to items held in the _offhand_ or lying on the _floor_ when _looking at them_
item.create_re.sand_paper.tooltip.summar: Can be used to _refine materials_. The process can be automated with a Deployer.
item.create_re.schematic.tooltip.behavio: Can be positioned using the Tools on Screen.
item.create_re.schematic.tooltip.summary: Holds a structure to be positioned and placed into the world. Position the Hologram as desired and use a _Schematicannon_ to build it.
item.create_re.schematic_and_quill.toolt: Select two _corner points_ using _R-Click_. Hold _Ctrl_ and Scroll to select locations mid-air.
_Ctrl-Scroll_ on the faces to adjust the size, then R-Click again to Save.
Used for _saving a Structure_ in your world to a _.nbt file_.
item.create_re.tree_fertilizer.tooltip.b: Creates a tree _regardless_ of its _spacing conditions_
item.create_re.tree_fertilizer.tooltip.s: A powerful combination of minerals useful for _growing saplings_ in tight spaces.
_Creates_ or _Moves_ its Mirror. _Sneak_ while using to open the _Configuration Interface_
_Mirrors Block placement_ while present in any _Hotbar Slot_.
item.create_re.wrench.tooltip.behaviour1: _Rotates components_ around the clicked face. _Sneak_ while interacting to _dismantle_ components.
item.create_re.wrench.tooltip.summary: Multi-purpose tool for working with your kinetic contraptions.
